bug.author: bdhammel
bug.summary: Setting clip value in `PostTrainLinearQuantizer` raises TypeError
bug.description:
I'm trying to clip by specifying the number to standard deviations in PostTrainLinearQuantizer <denchmark-code> quantizer = quantization.PostTrainLinearQuantizer( model, bits_activations=8, bits_parameters=8, bits_accum=32, mode=quantization.LinearQuantMode.SYMMETRIC, clip_acts=quantization.ClipMode.N_STD, no_clip_layers=None, clip_n_stds=3 ) quantizer.prepare_model() </denchmark-code>
However, this throws the error: <denchmark-code>TypeError: get_tensor_mean_n_stds_max_abs() got multiple values for argument 'n_stds' </denchmark-code>
It looks like the is taking two values: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/NervanaSystems/distiller/blob/master/distiller/quantization/range_linear.py#L97>https://github.com/NervanaSystems/distiller/blob/master/distiller/quantization/range_linear.py#L97</denchmark-link>
One is the tensor and one is the dimension to be used with ; the standard deviation is attached as a partial: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/NervanaSystems/distiller/blob/master/distiller/quantization/range_linear.py#L76>https://github.com/NervanaSystems/distiller/blob/master/distiller/quantization/range_linear.py#L76</denchmark-link>
However, only accepts the tensor and the std. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/NervanaSystems/distiller/blob/master/distiller/quantization/q_utils.py#L149>https://github.com/NervanaSystems/distiller/blob/master/distiller/quantization/q_utils.py#L149</denchmark-link>
modifying the source fixed this: <denchmark-code>def get_tensor_mean_n_stds_min_max(t, _, n_stds=1): if n_stds <= 0: raise ValueError('n_stds must be > 0, got {}'.format(n_stds)) mean = t.mean() std = t.std() min_val, max_val = get_tensor_min_max(t) min_val = torch.max(min_val, mean - n_stds * std) max_val = torch.min(max_val, mean + n_stds * std) return min_val, max_val
def get_tensor_mean_n_stds_max_abs(t, _, n_stds=1): min_val, max_val = get_tensor_mean_n_stds_min_max(t, _, n_stds) return torch.max(min_val.abs_(), max_val.abs_()) </denchmark-code>
Distiller version: 0.4.0-pre Pytorch version: 1.0.1 Python version: 3.6.8

comments.comment: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/bdhammel>@bdhammel</denchmark-link> Sorry for the late response, and thanks for catching this! Fixed in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/IntelLabs/distiller/commit/9af786b6599fe41fc95593e77d4631f0150b24d1>9af786b</denchmark-link> .
